data.title: Q+A with Christopher Columbus stars Cayden and Cameron Boozer
data.meta_description: Cayden and Cameron Boozer sit down with Kaitlyn Kupiec
data.text:
By Kaitlyn Kupiec

@kaitlynkupiec

The unbreakable bond between twins Cameron and Cayden Boozer has landed them both in ESPN’s Top 60 recruits for the class of 2025. The sons of Carlos Boozer, a two-time NBA All-Star, play for Christopher Columbus High School (FL).

Cameron excels at scoring across all three levels. Defensively, he showcases shot-blocking abilities and can effectively apply pressure, capable of guarding any of the five positions. Additionally, he stands out as a vocal leader, consistently contributing to team communication. Standing at 6-foot-9, Cameron combines size, strength and tenacity in his position as a power forward.

Cayden, a 6-foot-5 point guard, dictates the tempo of the game and effectively locates open teammates. He demonstrates proficiency in exploiting gaps, identifying open players and tightening defensive positions. His defensive skills, particularly in playing the lanes, contribute to his status as an elite lockdown defender.

Combined, the brothers put up 43 points in Saturday night’s 81-62 win against Long Island Lutheran (NY). Cameron’s 26 points, seven rebounds and five blocks helped him receive the most valuable player award against the Crusades.

The Springfield Student sat down with Cameron and Cayden to learn more about their life off the court.

Cameron Boozer

Does being twins help give you a special connection on the court?

“I wouldn’t say a special connection, but since we’re twins, we’ve been playing together our whole life, so that definitely helps a lot.”

You and Cayden both received offers from the same 14 schools. Have you talked with him about possibly attending the same school?

“Both of us are taking our recruitments separately but at the same time together. All of our decisions and all of our thoughts are separate. Every school we go to, we’re making it clear that they’re recruiting me and also recruiting Cayden.”

If you could have dinner with any famous athlete, dead or alive, who would it be?

“Lebron, 100 percent.”

What is your favorite pre-game meal?

“Outback Steakhouse.”

What cartoon character is most like you?

“I would say Spongebob.”

Cayden Boozer

How long have you and Cameron been playing basketball together?

“Basically our whole lives. I think we started playing together in first grade or second grade.”

In what ways do you and Cameron motivate each other?

“We’re both really good players. I feel like we push each other to try to be the best players we can possibly be, and we both want each other to succeed.”

What motto do you live by?

“Probably just stay in the moment. Sometimes you focus on what your future can be like, but just try to enjoy every moment that you get and live in the present.”

If you could have any celebrity come to a game of yours, who would you want it to be?

“There’s a lot, but one’s Drake. He’s one of the biggest artists right now.”

What is your favorite basketball memory?

“Winning our first state championship. That was a great experience, and our fans loved it, and the team was just as excited.”

Photo courtesy of The Athletic
